Title: Paul Thomas Anderson's epic race across a divided America in 'One Battle After Another'
Subhead: The filmmaker explores the extremist drift in the United States today in his new film, loosely adapted from Thomas Pynchon's novel 'Vineland.'

Title: In Paris, the Mausolée, formerly a clandestine graffiti residence, opens its doors to the public
Subhead: Lek & Sowat, a duo of graffiti artists who took over an abandoned supermarket beneath the beltway 15 years ago for an experimental project, are sharing the adventure this autumn.

Title: 'In Sudan, it is as if a congenital curse is at work. And the worst is yet to come'
Subhead: Straddling the Arab world and Africa, this enduring military dictatorship has seen almost continuous armed conflict since gaining independence in 1956. Its neighbor, the young state of South Sudan, is suffering a similar tragedy, writes Le Monde columnist Alain Frachon.

Title: Why Israel faces no sanctions from international sports bodies, unlike Russia
Subhead: Israeli teams, clubs and athletes continue to participate in international competitions, despite mounting calls for their exclusion. Independent UN experts urged FIFA and UEFA to impose sanctions on Tuesday.

Title: Relationship sex: Why many women still feel pressure to say yes
Subhead: Many women have sex with their partners even when they do not want to, out of reluctance to say no, uncertainty about desire, or fear of offending. Together, these reasons sketch the contours of a gray zone of consent.
